titles.title: Accountability and Transparency in Federal Campaigns Act of 2003

To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to require not less than 75 percent of the amount of individual contributions accepted by Congressional candidates to come from in-State residents, to increase disclosure requirements, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary: 6/19/2003--Introduced. Accountability and Transparency in Federal Campaigns Act of 2003 - Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 (FECA), as amended by the Bipartisan Campaign Reform Act of 2002, to require: (1) the Federal Election Commission (FEC) to require at least 75 percent of contributions accepted by candidates for the House of Representatives or the Senate to come from in-State residents; and (2) a monthly report to the FEC by each authorized committee of a candidate identifying each contribution of $200 or more received during the month, the contributor, the name of the candidate, and the office sought.
